alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:52PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Park, southeastern Clear Creek and west central Jefferson Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 152 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bailey, or 33 miles southwest of Denver, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evergreen, Highland Park, Kittredge, Echo Lake, Conifer, Shawnee, Aspen Park, Brookvale, Pine Junction, Bailey, Harris Park and Indian Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
